get.description: Get session information for the currently logged-in user.

post.description: Gets a list of ThoughtSpot users. To get details of a specific user, specify the user GUID or name.

user_identifier.description: GUID / name of the user to search

display_name.description: A unique display name string for the user account, usually their first and last name

group_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the group to which the user belongs.

account_status.description: Current status of the user account.

notify_on_share.description:
User preference for receiving email notifications when another ThoughtSpot user
shares a metadata object such as Answer, Liveboard, or Worksheet.

show_onboarding_experience.description: The user preference for revisiting the onboarding experience.

onboarding_experience_completed.description: Indicates if the user has completed the onboarding walkthrough.

org_identifiers.description: IDs or names of the Orgs to which the user belongs

home_liveboard_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the users home liveboard.

favorite_metadata.description: Metadata objects which are assigned as favorites of the user.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records that should be included.

post.description: Gets Orgs configured on a ThoughtSpot instance. Requires cluster administration privileges.

org_identifier.description: ID or name of the Org.

user_identifiers.description: GUIDs or names of the users for which you want to retrieve the Orgs data.

post.description: TAllows searching tags.

tag_identifier.description: Name or Id of the tag.

post.description: Allows searching groups. Requires administrator privileges.

default_liveboard_identifiers.description: GUID of Liveboards which will be assigned as default Liveboards for the users in the specified group.

group_identifier.description: GUID or name of the group

org_identifiers.description: ID or name of the Org to which the group belongs.

sub_group_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the sub groups. A subgroup is a group assigned to a parent group.

user_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the users assigned to the group.

visibility.description:
Visibility of the group. To make a group visible to other users and groups,
set the visibility to SHAREABLE.

post.description:
Allows searching for metadata objects. You can search for metadata objects 
such as Liveboard, Answer. Requires at least view access to the metadata object.

metadata.description: Metadata objects such as Liveboards, Answers, and Worksheets.

permissions.description: Object permission details to search by.

created_by_user_identifiers.description: GUID or name of user who created the metadata object.

dependent_object_version.description: Version of the dependent table of the metadata like worksheets.

exclude_objects.description: List of metadata objects to exclude from search.

favorite_object_options.description:
Options to sort the API response by objects set as favorites 
for the logged-in user or the users specified in the API request.

include_dependent_objects.description:
Includes dependents of the metadata object specified in the API request.
For example, a worksheet can consist of dependent objects such as Liveboards or Answers.

include_details.description: Includes complete details of the metadata objects.

include_headers.description: Includes headers of the metadata objects.

include_hidden_objects.description: Includes details of the hidden objects, such as a column in a worksheet or a table.

include_visualization_headers.description: Includes visualization headers of the specified Liveboard object.

include_worksheet_search_assist_data.description:
If search assistance lessons are configured on a worksheet, 
the API returns the search assist data for Worksheet objects.

modified_by_user_identifiers.description: Includes ID or names of the users who have modified the metadata object.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records that should be included.

sort_options.description: Sort options to filter metadata details.

tag_identifiers.description: Tags to filter metadata objects by

post.description: Fetches SQL query data for Liveboard and its visualizations.

metadata_identifier.description: ID or name of an Liveboard.

visualization_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of visualizations.

post.description: Fetches SQL query data for an Answer.

metadata_identifier.description: ID or name of an Answer.

post.description:
Exports Liveboard and visualization data in PDF, PNG, XLS, or CSV format.
Requires at least view access to the Liveboard.

metadata_identifier.description: GUID or name of the Liveboard object.

visualization_identifiers.description:
GUID or name of visualizations on the Liveboard. If this parameter is 
not defined, the API returns a report with all visualizations saved on a Liveboard.

runtime_filter.description:
JSON string representing runtime filter.
{ col1:'region', op1: 'EQ', val1: 'northeast' }

runtime_sort.description:
JSON string representing runtime sort.
{ sortCol1: 'region', asc1 : true, sortCol2 : 'date' }

post.description: Export report file for Answer data.

metadata_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the metadata.

runtime_filter.description:
JSON string representing runtime filter.
{ col1:region, op1: EQ, val1: northeast }

runtime_sort.description:
JSON string representing runtime sort.
{ sortCol1: region, asc1 :true, sortCol2 : date }

post.description: Fetch permission details for principal objects, such as users and groups.

principals.description: GUID or name of the principal.

metadata.description:
Metadata objects for which you want to fetch permission details. 
If not specified, the API returns permission details for all 
metadata objects that the specified users and groups can access.

post.description: Fetch permission details for metadata objects

metadata.description: GUID or name of the metadata object.

principals.description:
Principal objects for which you want to fetch permissions. 
If not specified, the API returns all users and groups that 
can access the specified metadata objects.

include_dependent_objects.description: Indicates whether to fetch permissions of depedent metadata objects.

post.description: Allows passing a search query string and retrieving data from ThoughtSpot.

logical_table_identifier.description: GUID of the data source object, such as a worksheet, view, or table.

data_format.description: JSON output format. By default, the API returns full data in the JSON.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records to include in a batch.

post.description: Fetches Liveboard data. Requires at least view access to the Liveboard.

metadata_identifier.description: GUID or name of the Liveboard.

visualization_identifiers.description: GUIDs or names of the visualizations on the Liveboard.

data_format.description: JSON output format. By default, the API returns full data in the JSON.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records to include in a batch.

post.description: Fetches data from a saved Answer. Requires at least view access to the Answer object.

metadata_identifier.description: GUID or name of the Answer.

data_format.description: JSON output format. By default, the API returns full data in the JSON.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records to include in a batch.

post.description: Fetches security audit logs. Requires administrator privileges.
Search local repository configuration
List the commit history of a metadata object

metadata_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the metadata.

branch_name.description: Name of the branch from which commit history needs to be displayed

record_offset.description: Record offset point in the commit history to display the response

record_size.description: Number of history records from record offset point to be displayed in the response

post.description: Search connection objects. Requires DATAMANAGEMENT privilege.

connections.description: List of connections and name pattern

data_warehouse_types.description: Array of types of data warehouse defined for the connection.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records that should be included.

tag_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of tags.

include_details.description: Indicates whether to include complete details of the connection objects.

post.description: Using this endpoint, you can programmatically create a login session for a user in ThoughtSpot.

password.description: The password of the user account

org_identifier.description: Id of the Org to be associated with the user login. If no input is provided then last logged in Org will be considered

remember_me.description: A flag to remember the user session. When set to true, sets a session cookie that persists in subsequent API calls.

post.description:
To programmatically create object session token for a user in ThoughtSpot, use this endpoint. 

You can generate the token for a user by providing password or secret key from the cluster. 

You need to enable trusted authentication to generate secret key. To generate secret key, follow below steps. 


 1. Click the Develop tab. 


 2. Under Customizations, click Settings. 


 3. To enable trusted authentication, turn on the toggle. 


 4. A secret_key for trusted authentication is generated. 


 5. Click the clipboard icon to copy the token. 


 

Password is given precedence over secretKey input, when both are included in the request.

object_id.description: GUID of the ThoughtSpot object. If set, the bearer will only have access to the specified Liveboard or another object.

password.description: The password of the user account

secret_key.description: The secret key string provided by the ThoughtSpot application server. ThoughtSpot generates this secret key when you enable trusted authentication.

validity_time_in_sec.description: Duration in seconds after which the token expires

org_id.description: Id of the Org to be associated with the user login. If no input is provided then last logged in Org will be considered

email.description: Indicates email id of the user. Use this parameter to provision a user just-in-time (JIT).

display_name.description: Indicates display name of the user. Use this parameter to provision a user just-in-time (JIT).

auto_create.description: Creates a new user if the specified username does not already exist in ThoughtSpot. Use this parameter to provision a user just-in-time (JIT).

group_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of the User Groups to which newly created user to be added. Use this parameter to provision a user just-in-time (JIT).

post.description:
To programmatically create full session token for a user in ThoughtSpot, use this endpoint. 

You can generate the token for a user by providing password or secret key from the cluster. 

You need to enable trusted authentication to generate secret key. To generate secret key, follow below steps. 


 1. Click the Develop tab. 


 2. Under Customizations, click Settings. 


 3. To enable trusted authentication, turn on the toggle. 


 4. A secret_key for trusted authentication is generated. 


 5. Click the clipboard icon to copy the token. 


 

Password is given precedence over secretKey input, when both are included in the request.

password.description: The password of the user account

secret_key.description: The secret key string provided by the ThoughtSpot application server. ThoughtSpot generates this secret key when you enable trusted authentication.

validity_time_in_sec.description: Duration in seconds after which the token expires

org_id.description: Id of the Org to be associated with the user login. If no input is provided then last logged in Org will be considered

email.description: Indicates email id of the user. Use this parameter to provision a user just-in-time (JIT).

display_name.description: Indicates display name of the user. Use this parameter to provision a user just-in-time (JIT).

auto_create.description: Creates a new user if the specified username does not already exist in ThoughtSpot. Use this parameter to provision a user just-in-time (JIT).

group_identifiers.description: ID or name of the groups to which the newly created user belongs. Use this parameter to provision a user just-in-time (JIT).

post.description: To log a user out of the current session, use this endpoint
To expire or revoke a token for a user, use this endpoint

Allows creating a user in ThoughtSpot. The API endpoint also allows you to assign the user to specific groups,
Orgs, and add favorite Liveboards and Answers. To create a user, you require administration privileges.

name.description: Name of the user. The username string must be unique.

display_name.description: A unique display name string for the user account, usually their first and last name

account_status.description: Current status of the user account.

org_identifiers.description: List of Org IDs to which the user belongs.

group_identifiers.description: GUIDs or names of the groups to which the newly created user belongs.

visibility.description: Visibility of the users. When set to SHARABLE, the user is visible to other users and groups when they try to share an object.

notify_on_share.description:
User preference for receiving email notifications when another ThoughtSpot
user shares a metadata object such as Answer, Liveboard, or Worksheet.

show_onboarding_experience.description: The user preference for revisiting the onboarding experience.

onboarding_experience_completed.description: flag to get the on-boarding experience is completed or not.

home_liveboard_identifier.description:
GUID of the Liveboard to set a default Liveboard for the user. 
ThoughtSpot displays this Liveboard on the Home page when the user logs in.

favorite_metadata.description: Metadata objects to add to the user's favorites list.

post.description: Updates a given user object. Requires administrator privileges.

name.description: Name of the user. The username string must be unique.

display_name.description: A unique display name string for the user account, usually their first and last name

visibility.description: Visibility of the users. When set to SHARABLE, the user is visible to other users and groups when they try to share an object.

account_status.description: Current status of the user account.

notify_on_share.description:
User preference for receiving email notifications when another ThoughtSpot user 
shares a metadata object such as Answer, Liveboard, or Worksheet.

show_onboarding_experience.description: The user preference for revisiting the onboarding experience.

onboarding_experience_completed.description: Indicates if the user has completed the onboarding and allows turning off the onboarding walkthrough.

group_identifiers.description: GUIDs or names of the groups.

home_liveboard_identifier.description:
GUID of the Liveboard to set a default Liveboard for the user. ThoughtSpot displays
this Liveboard on the Home page when the user logs in.

favorite_metadata.description: Metadata objects to add to the user's favorites list.

post.description: Deletes a user. Requires administrator privileges.
Imports user data from external databases to ThoughtSpot.

users.description: List of users needs to be imported.

default_password.description: The default password to assign to users if they do not have a password assigned in ThoughtSpot.

dry_run.description: If true, the API performs a test operation and returns user IDs whose data will be edited after the import.

delete_unspecified_users.description: If set to true, removes the users that are not specified in the API request.

user_identifier.description: GUID or name of the user.

post.description:
Logs out a user from their current session. This API operation makes
a user session invalid and forces the user to re-login.

user_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the users for force logging out their sessions.

post.description: Imports TML representation of metadata objects. Requires data management privileges.

import_policy.description: Specifies the import policy for the TML import.

create_new.description: If selected, creates TML objects with new GUIDs.

post.description: Exports TML representation of metadata objects

export_associated.description: Indicates whether to export associated metadata objects of specified metadata objects.

export_fqn.description:
Adds FQNs of the referenced objects. For example, if you are exporting a Liveboard and its associated objects, 
the API returns the Liveboard TML data with the FQNs of the referenced worksheet.
If the exported TML data includes FQNs, you don't need to manually add FQNs of the referenced objects during TML import.

post.description: Deletes metadata objects. Requires edit access to objects.

delete_disabled_objects.description: Indicates whether to delete disabled metadata objects.

post.description: Assigns a new author or transfers the ownership of the specified metadata objects.

metadata.description: GUID or name of the metadata object.

user_identifier.description: GUID or name of the user who you want to assign as the author.

current_owner_identifier.description:
GUID or name of the current author.  When defined, the metadata objects 
authored by the specified owner are filtered for the API operation.

post.description:
Share one or several metadata objects with users or groups. 
Requires edit access to metadata objects.

metadata_type.description:
Type of metadata.
1. Liveboard
2. Answers
3. LOGICAL_TABLE for any data object such as table, worksheet or view.
4. LOGICAL_COLUMN for a column of any data object such as table, worksheet or view.
5. CONNECTION for creating or modify data connections.
6. TAG for tag objects.
7. USER for user objects.
8. USER_GROUP for user group objects.
9. LOGICAL_RELATIONSHIP for table or worksheet joins. A join combines from one or several data object by using matching values

metadata_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of metadata objects.

permissions.description: Permission details for sharing the objects.

visualization_identifiers.description: Options to specify details of Liveboard.

emails.description: Email IDs to which notifications will be sent.

message.description: Message to be included in notification.

enable_custom_url.description: Sends object URLs in the customized format in email notifications.

type.description:
Type of metadata.
1. Liveboard
2. Answers
3. LOGICAL_TABLE for any data object such as table, worksheet or view.
4. LOGICAL_COLUMN for a column of any data object such as table, worksheet or view.
5. CONNECTION for creating or modify data connections.
6. TAG for tag objects.
7. USER for user objects.
8. USER_GROUP for user group objects.
9. LOGICAL_RELATIONSHIP for table or worksheet joins. A join combines from one or several data object by using matching values

principal.description: Details of users or user groups.

PermissionInput.description: Details of users or user groups.

identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the metadata.

type.description:
Type of metadata.
1. Liveboard
2. Answers
3. LOGICAL_TABLE for any data object such as table, worksheet or view.
4. LOGICAL_COLUMN for a column of any data object such as table, worksheet or view.
5. CONNECTION for creating or modify data connections.
6. TAG for tag objects.
7. USER for user objects.
8. USER_GROUP for user group objects.
9. LOGICAL_RELATIONSHIP for table or worksheet joins. A join combines from one or several data object by using matching values

include.description: Includes objects marked as favorite for the specified user GUIDs.

user_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of the users. If not specified then favorite of current logged in user is considered.

sql_queries.description: SQL query details of metadata objects.

include_cover_page.description: Indicates whether to include cover page with the Liveboard title.

include_custom_logo.description: Indicates whether to include customized wide logo in the footer if available.

include_filter_page.description: Indicates whether to include a page with all applied filters.

include_page_number.description: Indicates whether to include page number in the footer of each page.

truncate_table.description: Indicates whether to include only first page of the tables.

page_footer_text.description: Text to include in the footer of each page.

include_cover_page.description: Indicates whether to include cover page with the Liveboard title.

include_filter_page.description: Indicates whether to include a page with all applied filters.

field_name.description: Name of the field to apply the sort on.

valid_for_user_id.description: Username to whom the token is issued.

Type of metadata (Optional when given identifier is ID).
1. LIVEBOARD
2. ANSWERS
3. LOGICAL_TABLE for any data object such as table, worksheet or view.
4. LOGICAL_COLUMN for a column of any data object such as tables, worksheets or views.
